page.title: 05Occupations _ Bwlch-y-groes
page.content: Most people work on farms in this area,but some work away from home and travel to work.My father works at Aberporth at the Royal Aircraft Establishment and my brother works at the slaughterhouse in Cardigan.At Hafod farm farm machinery is sold.Most of the women are housewives and most of the men are farmers or farm workers.Of the parents of the school children there are two mechanics and two are unemployed.One is a builder and one is a social worker.Marged's mother is a secretary and Dona's father,who lives in California,is a carpenter.My mother is a housewife and Carol's father drives a J.C.B.Steven's father is a welder and he works in Penparc.Mrs George is a milk recorder.More workers are returning to work on the farms,some of them as part-time workers.
